org.trimou.engine.resolver

Class ReflectionResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.trimou.engine.config.AbstractConfigurationAware
      • org.trimou.engine.resolver.AbstractResolver
        • org.trimou.engine.resolver.ReflectionResolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationAware, WithPriority, EnhancedResolver, Resolver

    public class ReflectionResolver
extends AbstractResolver
    Reflection-based resolver attempts to find a matching member on the context object class and its superclasses. Methods have higher priority than fields.
    Author:
    Martin Kouba
    See Also:
    Reflections#findField(Class, String), Reflections#findMethod(Class, String)

      • MEMBER_CACHE_MAX_SIZE_KEY

        public static final ConfigurationKey MEMBER_CACHE_MAX_SIZE_KEY
        Limit the size of the cache (e.g. to avoid problems when dynamic class compilation is involved). Use zero value to disable the cache.

    • Method Detail

      • resolve

        public Object resolve(Object contextObject,
                      String name,
                      ResolutionContext context)
        Description copied from interface: Resolver
        Resolve the value from specified context object and name. This method should return as fast as possible. The best practice is to verify params first and return null in case of the resolver is not capable of resolving it.

        ResolutionContext allows to register a callback to release all the relevant resources after the resolved value is used.

        Parameters:
        contextObject - The current context object (aka base object), may be null
        name - The name (the key or its part) is never null
        context - The current resolution context
        Returns:
        the resolved object or null
        See Also:
        Placeholder.NULL

      • createHint

        public EnhancedResolver.Hint createHint(Object contextObject,
                                        String name,
                                        ResolutionContext context)
        Description copied from interface: EnhancedResolver
        This method may only be called right after the Resolver.resolve(Object, String, ResolutionContext) of the same resolver returns a non-null value. The parameters must be the same.

        The created hint is currently only used to skip the resolver chain for the first part of a key of a variable tag, i.e. foo for {{foo}} or {{foo.bar}}.

        This method must not return null.

        Specified by:
        createHint in interface EnhancedResolver
        Overrides:
        createHint in class AbstractResolver
        Returns:
        the hint
        See Also:
        Hints.INAPPLICABLE_HINT

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: AbstractConfigurationAware
        Can be overridden so that there's no need to call super.init(Configuration).
        Overrides:
        init in class AbstractConfigurationAware

      • getConfigurationKeys

        public Set<ConfigurationKey> getConfigurationKeys()
        Returns:
        the set of configuration keys to discover

      • invalidateMemberCache

        public void invalidateMemberCache(Predicate<Class<?>> predicate)
        The member cache may theoretically cause memory leaks due to using hard references to Class and Member instances. As a temporary workaround we provide a way to invalidate the cache or some of its entries (e.g. for a concrete classloader).
        Parameters:
        predicate - If null, all cache entries are discarded, otherwise an entry is only discarded if the given predicate returns true for the Object.getClass()
